payload.name: xyn-platform-canon
payload.content_markdown:
# Xyn Platform Canon (Global)

Purpose: any
Scope: global

## Governance Defaults
- All durable outputs are provisional until ratified.
- Prefer deterministic, explicit lifecycle transitions.
- Preserve auditability for generated and human-authored artifacts.

## Composition Rules
- Keep naming predictable across namespace and project scopes.
- Prefer additive metadata changes over destructive rewrites.
- Avoid embedding secrets or credentials in generated output.

payload.name: xyn-coder-canon
payload.content_markdown:
# Xyn Coder Canon (Global)

Purpose: coder
Scope: global

## CodegenResult v1
- Schema file: `schemas/codegen_result.v1.schema.json`
- Output must conform to `schema_version: codegen_result.v1`.
- Always emit `patches` (unified diff) for changes. `write_files` may appear for new files, but patches are preferred.

## Repo Targets (Defaults)
- `xyn-api`:
  - Python + Django backend
  - Reuse existing service/modules before introducing new ones
  - Keep migrations reversible and deterministic
- `xyn-ui`:
  - React + TypeScript frontend
  - Favor existing design system patterns and token-driven styling

## Validation
- Include focused tests for changed behavior.
- Mention assumptions and unresolved risks explicitly.

payload.name: xyn-planner-canon
payload.content_markdown:
# Xyn Planner Canon (Global)

Purpose: planner
Scope: global

## ImplementationPlan v1
- Schema file: `schemas/implementation_plan.v1.schema.json`
- Output must conform to `schema_version: implementation_plan.v1`.
- Primary output is `work_items[]` with actionable steps.
- Include `capabilities_required` and `module_refs` per work_item.
- Include `plan_rationale` with gaps detected and why the next slice was chosen.
- Use `module_catalog.v1.json` and `run_history_summary.v1.json` artifacts as inputs.

## Lifecycle Defaults
- Treat generated plans as drafts unless explicitly ratified.
- Prefer smallest viable delivery slices with explicit dependencies.

## Safety
- Avoid destructive commands in plan outputs.
- Call out missing prerequisites before proposing execution steps.

payload.name: explainer-script-default
payload.content_markdown:
# Explainer Script Defaults
- Audience: mixed technical/non-technical
- Tone: clear, confident, warm, governance-substrate feel
- Structure: problem -> approach -> why it matters -> concrete example
- Avoid: unverified claims, competitor callouts, political content
- Output: spoken narration text, optionally HOOK/BODY/CLOSE markers

payload.name: explainer-storyboard-default
payload.content_markdown:
# Explainer Storyboard Defaults
- Output MUST be strict JSON matching canonical video_spec_json shape
- Typical scene duration: 8-20 seconds
- Include timing, on-screen text, visuals, narration per scene
- Do not invent facts; structure only from provided inputs

payload.name: explainer-visual-prompts-default
payload.content_markdown:
# Explainer Visual Prompt Defaults
- Visual language: clean diagrams, UI callouts, minimal iconography, brand-safe
- Default: avoid photoreal humans
- For each scene include: image_prompt, optional negative_prompt, motion_hint, aspect_ratio=16:9
- Output: JSON keyed by scene_id

payload.name: explainer-narration-default
payload.content_markdown:
# Explainer Narration Defaults
- Spoken-friendly rewrite with smooth cadence
- Avoid jargon unless explicitly requested
- Optional SSML only when requested
- Optional caption chunking guidance

payload.name: explainer-title-description-default
payload.content_markdown:
# Explainer Title/Description Defaults
- Produce 5 title options, 2 descriptions, and 3 CTAs
- No hype; concise and concrete
- Output JSON: {titles, descriptions, ctas}
